p: Most patients were male ( n = 43; 60.6%) and white ( n = 60; 84.5%), with a median age of 64.0 (range 27‐75) years. The majority of patients had Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 1 ( n = 44; 62.0%) and good/intermediate cytogenetic risk (ie, favorable, intermediate‐I, or intermediate‐II risk; n = 50; 70.4%) (Supporting Information Table S1). Seven (9.9%) patients received prior hypomethylating agents (decitabine or azacitidine).
